title: Interpretive Framework Design for Strengthening Generational Professional Capital Among Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic mathematics pedagogy and at least five years of teaching experience
context.additional_context: A course for elementary teachers aged 40+ focusing on analyzing professional capital based on generational characteristics and enhancing mathematics teaching competencies in mobile environments. Includes self-reflection and peer feedback activities using mixed research methods.

learning_goals: Participants can analyze generational interpretation framework components (self-awareness, task awareness, motivation, etc.) and connect them to their teaching styles.
Participants can develop action plans applying the three dimensions of professional capital (social, human, decisional) to mathematics instruction.
Participants can explain methods for mediating generational differences in teaching competencies through peer interactions (including formative assessments) in mobile microlearning environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
